triples.name: Linear temporal logic
triples.relevance: The paper uses LTL to express complex temporal properties and specifications over finite traces for stochastic systems.

triples.name: Barrier certificate
triples.relevance: The paper proposes control barrier certificates as a novel approach to solve reachability tasks and verify safety properties in stochastic systems.

triples.name: Stochastic control
triples.relevance: The paper addresses synthesis of control policies for discrete-time stochastic control systems with uncertainty in system dynamics.

triples.name: Automata theory
triples.relevance: The paper uses automata representations to decompose LTL specifications into simpler reachability tasks for synthesis.

triples.name: Reachability analysis
triples.relevance: The paper decomposes specifications into reachability tasks as the core building blocks for solving the control synthesis problem.

triples.name: Heating, ventilation, and air conditioning
triples.relevance: The paper demonstrates the proposed approach on room temperature control, a practical HVAC application.

triples.name: Automated lane keeping systems
triples.relevance: The paper validates the approach on lane-keeping of a vehicle modeled as a four-dimensional single-track kinematic model.

triples.name: Kinematics
triples.relevance: The paper uses a kinematic model to represent vehicle dynamics for the lane-keeping control synthesis task.

triples.name: Discretization
triples.relevance: The paper compares its control barrier certificate approach against discretization-based methods from the literature.
